intro: Boechera evadens, commonly known as the desert jewelflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually basal and rosette-shaped, helping to conserve water. Boechera evadens is also notable for its genetic diversity and role in ecological studies of plant adaptation.
